THRONEROOM.name: THRONEROOM
THRONEROOM.desc: The King of Desquere sits on the throne before you, with two guards standing at his side. You should see what he wants to TALK to you about.

exits.condition: That's the king's private room, you shouldn't go in there.
That's the servants room, you have no need to go in there.

KING HAVASQUE: It's good to see you again, but I have dire news. It seems that the ruler of Illerium is preparing an army to attack Desquere. We have reports that he is trying to build an army of dragons, though attempts so far have been unsuccessful. We need you to head north through the Forests of Enigvera, to enter the Caves of Koinonia. From there you can reach Illerium and defeat their ruler. Before you leave, you should visit the armory and the sage tower to get some equipment. They're directly EAST and WEST of the fountain, but you already knew that. Now go forth and be the Champion of Desquere once more!
You start rushing towards the king to attack him, but the two guards standing at his side strike you down. (-10).

GRANDHALLS.name: GRANDHALLS
GRANDHALLS.desc: You are in the south end of a large entry hall, just outside the throne room. Smells from a meal earlier in the day waft out from the nearby dining room.

exits.condition: You yell out and your voice echoes in the large room.

GRANDHALLM.name: GRANDHALLM
GRANDHALLM.desc: You are in the middle end of a large entry hall, and elegant banners clothe the walls around you, depicting past victories of Desquere.

exits.condition: You look closer at the banners and see King Havasque himself depicting in this one repelling waves of marauding Wildfolk from the mountains of Revick.
You yell out and your voice echoes in the large room.

GRANDHALLN.name: GRANDHALLN
GRANDHALLN.desc: You are in the north end of a large entry hall, steps away from the front door to the keep.

exits.condition: There's a lever here to lock the gate, but that's only for emergencies.
There's a beautiful pale white stone wall blocking your way.
You yell out and your voice echoes in the large room.

BALLROOMS.name: BALLROOMS
BALLROOMS.desc: You are in a large ballroom. Tall elegant windows adorn the walls, bathing the room in light. Chandeliers float above your head that fill the room with light when celebrations go past sunset.

exits.condition: Looking out the window, you see the green rolling hills of Desquere, with a few houses scattered across the landscape.
There's a beautiful pale white stone wall blocking your way.
You yell out and your voice echoes in the large room.

BALLROOMN.name: BALLROOMN
BALLROOMN.desc: You are in a large ballroom, near the musician's stage. A sleek, black piano sits atop the stage, reflecting the sun's rays.

exits.condition: A curtain of heavy fabric sits on the northern wall to make sure that the musician's sound doesn't bounce back to themselves.
Looking out the window, you see the green rolling hills of Desquere, with a few houses scattered across the landscape.
You yell out and your voice echoes in the large room.

DININGROOM.name: DININGROOM
DININGROOM.desc: A long oaken table fills the majority of this room. The dishes from the last meal still litter the table.

exits.condition: A banner with the insignia of Desquere, a violet stag on a field of green, fills the wall here.
There's a beautiful pale white stone wall blocking your way.
As you survey the remains of this decadent meal, you give a small prayer of thanks for the bounty that the great god Omnisci has blessed Desquere with.

KITCHEN.name: KITCHEN
KITCHEN.desc: A pudgy, but jovial man stands in the middle of the kitchen giving directions to the workers around him.

exits.condition: Ovens filled with everything from bread to boar cover the wall, filling the room with warmth.
Staggering, shifting towers of dishes sit beside wash basins, as dishhands slowly work their way through them.
Shelves bending with the weight of spices and herbs from different countries cover this wall.
There's a beautiful pale white stone wall blocking your way.

CHEF FARIQ: It's good to see you! Though you could still use with putting a little more meat on your bones. Make sure to take something before you head out on whatever quest the king has for you this time.
You take a large LEG OF LAMB that was left over from lunch. (Heals 3 health when used)

COURTYARDS.name: COURTYARDS
COURTYARDS.desc: Standing before the entrance to the keep, the bricks of the courtyard beneath your feet you feel at home. The fountain is just north of you.

exits.condition: You give a cheery hello to some of the guards patrolling the courtyard.

COURTYARDSW.name: COURTYARDSW
COURTYARDSW.desc: The bricks of the courtyard are a little worn out here, and could use some repair.

exits.condition: The tall red stone walls defending the castle are a constant reminder of the alliance Desquere has with the Wesseryians, rulers of the Red Hills.
A tall tower fills your view, but you've never seen anyone find a way to get up there.
You give a cheery hello to some of the guards patrolling the courtyard.

COURTYARDW.name: COURTYARDW
COURTYARDW.desc: You stand outside the armory, where you've spent thousands of hours training.

exits.condition: You give a cheery hello to some of the guards patrolling the courtyard.

COURTYARDNW.name: COURTYARDNW
COURTYARDNW.desc: Vines wind through the courtyard bricks here, beginning to crawl up the walls.

exits.condition: The tall red stone walls defending the castle are a constant reminder of the alliance Desquere has with the Wesseryians, rulers of the Red Hills.
The tall red stone walls defending the castle are a constant reminder of the alliance Desquere has with the Wesseryians, rulers of the Red Hills.
You give a cheery hello to some of the guards patrolling the courtyard.

COURTYARDN.name: COURTYARDN
COURTYARDN.desc: You stand just before the gate to the castle.

exits.condition: You give a cheery hello to some of the guards patrolling the courtyard.

COURTYARDNE.name: COURTYARDNE
COURTYARDNE.desc: The bricks here are smudged with soot from the sage's last experiment that went wrong...

exits.condition: The tall red stone walls defending the castle are a constant reminder of the alliance Desquere has with the Wesseryians, rulers of the Red Hills.
The tall red stone walls defending the castle are a constant reminder of the alliance Desquere has with the Wesseryians, rulers of the Red Hills.
You give a cheery hello to some of the guards patrolling the courtyard.

COURTYARDE.name: COURTYARDE
COURTYARDE.desc: As you stand in the courtyard outside the sage's tower, plumes of blue smoke puff out it's chimney.

exits.condition: You give a cheery hello to some of the guards patrolling the courtyard.

COURTYARDSE.name: COURTYARDSE
COURTYARDSE.desc: The greenhouse sits just south of this corner of the courtyard, growing food, herbs, and magical ingredients for the castle.

exits.condition: The tall red stone walls defending the castle are a constant reminder of the alliance Desquere has with the Wesseryians, rulers of the Red Hills.
You give a cheery hello to some of the guards patrolling the courtyard.

GREENHOUSE.name: GREENHOUSE
GREENHOUSE.desc: Vines, flowers, bushes, and trees fill this room with life. A smiling woman is walking between the plants, watering some and whispering to others.

exits.condition: Rows of flowers in hues of pinks and blues fill this wall of the greenhouse.
Winding trees are interwoven on this wall, making a tapestry of life.
A smattering of vegetables are planted along this wall, with everything from potatoes and rutabagas to arugala and basil.

LILIA: Why if it isn't the champion of Desquere himself. I heard that you're going to be traveling through the Forests of Enigvera. I have some advice for you. There are loads of flora in that forest. Remember that the purple berries are safe to eat, even claimed to have healing properties by some.

ARMORY.name: ARMORY
ARMORY.desc: Racks of equipment fill the room. Your old mentor, Perrin, stands near the one of the racks inspecting the swords upon it.

exits.condition: Barrels bristling with arrows are lined along this wall.
Swords of differing lengths and styles fill this wall.
Shields sit on this wall, but you've always opted against them. A strong offense is the best defense.

PERRIN: Another quest from the king? Well then you'll probably need something to defend yourself. I'd suggest you TAKE one of the swords in here with you. You can ATTACK enemies in your way, but don't forget that there might be other ways to get past issues.
You take a sword off one of the racks.

SAGETOWER.name: SAGETOWER
SAGETOWER.desc: The sage's tower is filled with all manner of alchemy equipment, with various magical ingredients scattered about. Viz, the court sage, is busy mixing liquids as one of the tables.

exits.condition: This wall has a bookshelf filled with books with strange markings that you don't understand.
Beakers of boiling liquids rest on a table beside this wall.
Shelves filled with magical ingredients cover this wall.
VIZ: I assume you're here to ask for my patented health potions. Of course you can take one. Just let me get back to my work.
You take a red potion from one of the tables. (Heals 5 health when used)

CASTLEGATE.name: CASTLEGATE
CASTLEGATE.desc: A guard stands at the gate, leaning on his pike.

exits.condition: A door to the top of the castle wall is embeddded here, but you don't need to go up there.
The tall red stone walls defending the castle are a constant reminder of the alliance Desquere has with the Wesseryians, rulers of the Red Hills.
GUARD HAROLD: Good luck on your quest!

FOREST1.name: FOREST1
FOREST1.desc: You are at the entry to the Forests of Enigvara. Magic or Nature has made it so that very few people will venture into the forest, and fewer still will return.

exits.condition: Thick vegetation blocks your way.
Thick vegetation blocks your way.
You tell yourself there is nothing to fear.

FOUNTAIN.name: FOUNTAIN
FOUNTAIN.desc: A beautiful fountain is the centerpiece of this courtyard. It depicts the god Omnisci, with water pouring from his hands over the heads of Beridan and Teveya, the first king and queen of Desquere.

exits.condition: You praise Omnisci for the guidance given to Desquere's rulers.

FOREST2.name: FOREST2
FOREST2.desc: Now being deeper in the forest, the light fades as only a few beams of light make their way through the leaves above. The path turns toward the east.

exits.condition: Thick vegetation blocks your way.
You tell yourself there is nothing to fear.

WILDPATH1.name: WILDPATH1
WILDPATH1.desc: You're at the start of a trail made by some wild animal. It continues deeper west into the forest.

exits.condition: Thick vegetation blocks your way.
Thick vegetation blocks your way.
You tell yourself there is nothing to fear.

WILDPATH2.name: WILDPATH2
WILDPATH2.desc: The vegetation is not well cleared out here, but you're able to see that whatever animal made this path seemed to head north.

exits.condition: Thick vegetation blocks your way.
Thick vegetation blocks your way.
You tell yourself there is nothing to fear.

WILDPATH3.name: WILDPATH3
WILDPATH3.desc: You see a large footprint in a muddy patch of dirt. You're pretty sure that it's a bear track. It's hard to tell though where it went from here.

exits.condition: You try to squeeze through here, but you can't seem to find anyway to get through the dense underbrush.
The only way to head east right now would be to climb a tree, and you really don't want to do that in full armor.
You tell yourself there is nothing to fear.

WILDPATH4.name: WILDPATH4
WILDPATH4.desc: You stand outside a cave mouth, and hear the faint growls of a bear echoing from inside.

exits.condition: Thick vegetation blocks your way.
Thick vegetation blocks your way.
You tell yourself there is nothing to fear.

BEARDEN.name: BEARDEN
BEARDEN.desc: You enter the cave and find a bear growling at you and ready to defend itself.

exits.condition: The cave isn't that big, it really has just enough space for both you and the bear.
The cave isn't that big, it really has just enough space for both you and the bear.
The cave isn't that big, it really has just enough space for both you and the bear.
You growl at the bear.
You attack the bear, and it responds by clawing at you (-1)
exits.onkill: Now that the bear is dead, you could TAKE meat from it.

DEADBEAR.name: BEARDEN
DEADBEAR.desc: Now that the bear is dead, this cave is much safer to stay in.

exits.condition: The cave isn't that big, it really has just enough space for both you and the dead bear.
The cave isn't that big, it really has just enough space for both you and the dead bear.
The cave isn't that big, it really has just enough space for both you and the dead bear.
You apologize to the bear for killing it.
You take Meat from the bear.

FOREST3.name: FOREST3
FOREST3.desc: Vines overhang into the path, but there's still more than enough space to get through here.

exits.condition: Thick vegetation blocks your way.
Thick vegetation blocks your way.
You tell yourself there is nothing to fear.

WOLFFIGHT.name: FOREST4
WOLFFIGHT.desc: An injured wolf lies in the middle of the path, blocking your way and snarling at you.

exits.condition: As long as the wolf is still alive you can't really get past it.
Thick vegetation blocks your way.
Thick vegetation blocks your way.
You tell the wolf that it has nothing to fear.
You attack the wolf, and it responds by biting you. (-1)
exits.onkill: With the wolf dead, you should be able to pass by without issue

FOREST4.name: FOREST4
FOREST4.desc: The wolf lies dead in the middle of the path, but at least you can pass by now.

exits.condition: Thick vegetation blocks your way.
Thick vegetation blocks your way.
You offer a prayer up to Stagana, goddess of the wilds.
You take the pelt from the wolf.

FOREST5.name: FOREST5
FOREST5.desc: You see an open glade north of you.

exits.condition: Thick vegetation blocks your way.
T
You tell yourself there is nothing to fear.

BERRY1.name: BERRY1
BERRY1.desc: This little path has a few berry bushes along it. The one closest to you has red berries.

exits.condition: Thick vegetation blocks your way.
Thick vegetation blocks your way.
Somebody must know if these berries are good...
You pick a few Red Berries from the bush.

BERRY2.name: BERRY2
BERRY2.desc: This little path has a few berry bushes along it. The one closest to you has purple berries.

exits.condition: Thick vegetation blocks your way.
Thick vegetation blocks your way.
Somebody must know if these berries are good...
You pick a few Purple Berries from the bush.

BERRY3.name: BERRY3
BERRY3.desc: This little path has a few berry bushes along it. The one closest to you has blue berries.

exits.condition: Thick vegetation blocks your way.
Thick vegetation blocks your way.
Thick vegetation blocks your way.
Somebody must know if these berries are good...
You pick a few Blue Berries from the bush.

GLADE.name: GLADE
GLADE.desc: The forest opens up around you, as you find yourself in a open glade. The sun kisses your skin, as you finally come out from the shadows of the forest. The path continues northward from here.

exits.condition: There really is no way to enter back into the forest in that direction from here.
There really is no way to enter back into the forest in that direction from here.
You let out a loud yawn.

OLDTREE.name: OLDTREE
OLDTREE.desc: A withered, dead tree blocks the way northward here, and the path curves to the west.

exits.condition: You're not able to climb over the tree, and the vegetation around it is just as hard to traverse.
Thick vegetation blocks your way.
You tell yourself there is nothing to fear.

HUNTERTENT.name: HUNTERTENT
HUNTERTENT.desc: You come up to a small tent where an elf sits wrapped in furs. They seem to be a trader of some sort.

exits.condition: Thick vegetation blocks your way.
Thick vegetation blocks your way.

RANGER TRENT: It's not often I see another person in these forests. I have a proposition for you. If you can bring me a wolf pelt, I'll give you a Sharpened Sword for your troubles. If you can bring me Bear Meat, I'll make Bear Stew for both of us.
You give the Hunter the Wolf Pelt. He offers a Sharpened Sword for you to TAKE in return.
You give the Hunter the Bear Meat. He offers Bear Stew for you to TAKE in return.
You take the Sharpened Sword from the Hunter.
You take some Bear Stew from the Hunter.

FOREST6.name: FOREST6
FOREST6.desc: The vegetation is getting a little bit shorter here, as the ground slopes up to meet the mountain that houses the caves of Koionia.

exits.condition: Thick vegetation blocks your way.
Thick vegetation blocks your way.
You tell yourself there is nothing to fear.

CAVEOPENING.name: CAVEOPENING
CAVEOPENING.desc: You stand just outside the Caves of Koinonia, legendary home of the dwarves. Sadly it descended into chaos and bloodshed years ago, and now is mostly habitated by spiders and other nuisances.

exits.condition: Northward is a long and arduous climb over mountains, you'd much rather go through the caves.
A large gray and brown speckled boulder blocks the way south.
You give a prayer to Omnisci thanking them for your safe travel through the forest.

SPIDER1.name: CAVE1
SPIDER1.desc: You walk into the cave to be meeted with the first of many denizens inside. A large spider blocks your way, mandible clacking at you.

exits.condition: There's a rough-hewn wall there, as well as the fact that the spider is set on blocking your way.
That's the way forward, but you can't get past the spider without killing it, or pacifying it in some way.
There's a rough-hewn wall there, as well as the fact that the spider is set on blocking your way.
You yell at the spider hoping to scare it away. It doesn't work.
You attack the spider, and it bites you. (-1)
exits.onkill: The spider drops to the floor, twitching in it's death throes.

CAVE1.name: CAVE1
CAVE1.desc: The curled up body of the giant spider fills most of the hallway here, but you're able to squeez past.

exits.condition: There's a rough-hewn wall there.
There's a rough-hewn wall there.
You curse the spider. Spiders should only be big enough to eat little bugs.

CAVE2.name: CAVE2
CAVE2.desc: The path makes a T here. Tunnels lead away to the north, south, and east.

exits.condition: There's a rough-hewn wall there.
Even though you're speaking at a normal level, your voice echoes in this errie place.

CAVE3.name: CAVE3
CAVE3.desc: Collapsed rock fills much of the tunnel here, but you can still sneak by to head north and south.

exits.condition: Collapsed rock and slate fills that side of the hallway blocking off any potential tunnels heading that direction.
There's a rough-hewn wall there.
Even though you're speaking at a normal level, your voice echoes in this errie place.

CAVE4.name: CAVE4
CAVE4.desc: This path is sloped heavily, making it hard to keep your footing.

exits.condition: There's a rough-hewn wall there.
There's a rough-hewn wall there.
Even though you're speaking at a normal level, your voice echoes in this errie place.

CAVE5.name: CAVE5
CAVE5.desc: A faint smell of brimstone fills the air here.

exits.condition: There's a rough-hewn wall there.
There's a rough-hewn wall there.
Even though you're speaking at a normal level, your voice echoes in this errie place.

DRAGONANGRY.name: DRAGONDEN
DRAGONANGRY.desc: A small golden-scaled dragon sits in this room. They're standing on their hind legs trying to look as big as they can. It would probably be difficult to get past it at the moment.

exits.condition: There's a rough-hewn wall there, as well as the fact that the dragon is set on blocking your way.
That's the way forward, but you can't get past the dragon without killing it, or pacifying it in some way.
That's the way forward, but you can't get past the dragon without killing it, or pacifying it in some way.

YOU: Hey buddy, we can be friends right? Would you like to be PET? I think you'd like that.
The dragon looks a little confused.
You pet the dragon and it purrs in happiness, relaxing.
As you start to strike at the dragon, it opens it's mouth. Moments later, all that remains of you is a pile of ash, and a glowing pool of metal.

DRAGONHAPPY.name: DRAGONDEN
DRAGONHAPPY.desc: The dragon is now very friendly and rubbing against your leg. You can get past with no issue.

exits.condition: There's a rough-hewn wall there.
There's a rough-hewn wall there.
YOU: Who's a good boy?

CAVE7.name: CAVE7
CAVE7.desc: You see a glint of something metallic to the north. You see the glint of the metallic-scaled dragon to the east. Otherwise this corner is pretty nondescript.

exits.condition: There's a rough-hewn wall there.
There's a rough-hewn wall there.
Even though you're speaking at a normal level, your voice echoes in this errie place.

VAULT.name: VAULT
VAULT.desc: This room looks like it was an old vault that was emptied out ages ago, but there's still a small amount of gold in here.

exits.condition: Empty shelves fill this wall.
A shimmering spiderweb spans the doorway in that direction. It's not worth getting caught in it.
There's a statue of an old dwarven royal against this wall that's much too heavy for looters to take.
Even though you're speaking at a normal level, your voice echoes in this errie place.
You take the Gold that is still left in the room.

SPIDER2.name: CAVE6
SPIDER2.desc: A large spider stands blocking your way. It's picked a T in the tunnels so more prey will be passing through the area.

exits.condition: There's a rough-hewn wall there, as well as the fact that the spider is set on blocking your way.
That's a way forward, but you can't get past the spider without killing it, or pacifying it in some way.
That's a way forward, but you can't get past the spider without killing it, or pacifying it in some way.
You yell at the spider hoping to scare it away. It doesn't work.
You attack the spider, and it bites you. (-1)
exits.onkill: The spider drops to the floor, twitching in it's death throes.

CAVE6.name: CAVE6
CAVE6.desc: A T with paths leading south, west, and east meets here. The spider you killed also lies in the center curled up in a ball.

exits.condition: There's a rough-hewn wall there
Even though you're speaking at a normal level, your voice echoes in this errie place.

CAVE8.name: CAVE8
CAVE8.desc: The smell of rotting flesh and sweat wafts down this tunnel from the east.

exits.condition: There's a rough-hewn wall there.
There's a rough-hewn wall there.
Even though you're speaking at a normal level, your voice echoes in this errie place.

GOBLINFIGHT.name: GOBLINDEN
GOBLINFIGHT.desc: As you enter this room, a goblin jumps up, dagger in hand to defend itself.

exits.condition: There's a rough-hewn wall there, as well as the fact that the goblin is set on blocking your way.
There's a rough-hewn wall there, as well as the fact that the goblin is set on blocking your way.
There's a rough-hewn wall there, as well as the fact that the goblin is set on blocking your way.
you shout a battle cry at the goblin, and it snarls back at you.
You attack the goblin, and it stabs you. (-2)
exits.onkill: The goblin cries out in pain, as you skewer it on your sword.

GOBLINDEN.name: GOBLINDEN
GOBLINDEN.desc: This room is filled with rags and all sorts of strange items. There might be something worthwhile to TAKE if you can find it.

exits.condition: A few carcasses are pushed against this wall. The smell is extremely nauseating.
A bed of sorts is made out of rags and straw resting against this wall.
The goblin took care of his business by that wall. You have no interest going any closer to that than you absolutely have to.
You wonder aloud how the goblin was able to stand the stench of this room.
Rummaging around the room, you eventually find a small silver key. You take it with you.

CAVE9.name: CAVE9
CAVE9.desc: Dwarven carvings are still visible at this point in the tunnels, but you never learned their language.

exits.condition: There's a rough-hewn wall there.
There's a rough-hewn wall there.
Even though you're speaking at a normal level, your voice echoes in this errie place.

CAVE10.name: CAVE10
CAVE10.desc: While the tunnel mainly heads north to south here, the trail winds back and forth. This was done as a way to stop dragons from being able to quickly traverse the tunnels.

exits.condition: There's a rough-hewn wall there.
There's a rough-hewn wall there.
Even though you're speaking at a normal level, your voice echoes in this errie place.

CAVE11.name: CAVE11
CAVE11.desc: A set of stairs heading west here signal the fact that you're getting close to the exits from the caves and nearing Illerium.

exits.condition: There's a rough-hewn wall here.
There's a rough-hewn wall there.
Even though you're speaking at a normal level, your voice echoes in this errie place.

CAVE12.name: CAVE12
CAVE12.desc: Collapsed pillars block the paths north and south as you find yourself in the middle of what used to be the grand hall of the dwarves.

exits.condition: Collapsed pillars block your way.
Collapsed pillars block your way.
Even though you're speaking at a normal level, your voice echoes in this errie place.

SPIDER3.name: CAVE13
SPIDER3.desc: A large spider sits in a spiderweb blocking the way south.

exits.condition: There's a rough-hewn wall there.
There's a rough-hewn wall there.
You'll need to defeat the spider to continue forward.
You yell at the spider hoping to scare it away. It doesn't work.
You attack the spider, and it bites you. (-1)
exits.onkill: The spider drops to the floor, twitching in it's death throes. The spiderweb was also cut down during your fight.

CAVE13.name: CAVE13
CAVE13.desc: The mangled spider corpse lies to the side of the room, and the spiderweb hangs limply along the sides of the tunnel.

exits.condition: There's a rough-hewn wall there.
There's a rough-hewn wall there.
You curse the spider. Spiders should only be big enough to eat little bugs.

CAVE14.name: CAVE14
CAVE14.desc: The tunnels meet in a T here, with paths going north, south, and west.

exits.condition: There's a rough-hewn wall there.
Even though you're speaking at a normal level, your voice echoes in this errie place.

DWARVENFORGE.name: DWARVENFORGE
DWARVENFORGE.desc: You enter a room with a dwarf standing before an anvil. The clang of his hammer fills the room, and you wonder how you didn't hear it earlier...

exits.condition: Cabinets line these walls, where you assume the dwarf keeps his tools.
A large pool of water is embedded in this wall, presumably to cool the metal.
A forge fills this wall, filling the room with oppressive warmth and orange light.

GALTHOR: Well I'll be, an actual human. My name's Galthor. Looking at you, I'd say you know how to handle yourself in a fight. Is there anyway you could help me out? A goblin stole a key of mine that I need. If you can get it for me, I'll TRADE you a Dwarven Axe.
You give Galthor the Key. He offers a Dwarven Axe for you to TAKE in return.
You take the Dwarven Axe from the Hunter.

CAVE15.name: CAVE15
CAVE15.desc: The air is fresher here. You must be close to the exit.

exits.condition: There's a rough-hewn wall there.
There's a rough-hewn wall there.
Even though you're speaking at a normal level, your voice echoes in this errie place.

TOLLWAY.name: CAVE16
TOLLWAY.desc: A dwarf stands in the hallway here blocking your way. He has one hand on his axe, but he doesn't seem to be particularly aggressive. He does have a somewhat crazy look in his eyes though...

exits.condition: You can see the way out, but the dwarf won't let you pass.
There's a rough-hewn wall there, as well as the dwarf blocking your progress.
There's a rough-hewn wall there, as well as the dwarf blocking your progress.

MORDEJ: I am Mordej. I am the last descendant of the dwarves of Koinonia. If you wish to pass through my lands, you must pay a fee. You can TRADE gold for passage, or you can FIGHT me and prove yourself.
You give Mordej the Gold. He steps out of the way, allowing you to pass.
You attack Mordej, and he attacks you. (-3)
exits.onkill: Mordej, bleeding from multiple wounds, steps back respecting your power.

CAVE16.name: CAVE16
CAVE16.desc: Mordej stands to the side, appeased by your actions. You can now head north to leave the caves and enter Illerium.

exits.condition: There's a rough-hewn wall there.
There's a rough-hewn wall there.
MORDEJ: You are free to come and go as you please. Perhaps one day the dwarves of Koinonia may return.

CAVEEXIT.name: CAVEEXIT
CAVEEXIT.desc: Light streams through the cave exit. As you look out, you see the castle of Illerium directly north of you. Your quest is nearing it's completion.

exits.condition: There's a rough-hewn wall there.
There's a rough-hewn wall there.
You offer a prayer to Omnisci for taking you safely through the Caves of Koinonia.

ILGATE.name: ILGATE
ILGATE.desc: As you enter Castle Illerium, you're surprised the gate is open for you.

exits.condition: Marbled rock walls block your path.
Marbled rock walls block your path.
You take a stabilizing breath, preparing yourself for the battle ahead.

ILCOURTYARDS.name: ILCOURTYARDS
ILCOURTYARDS.desc: Bricks below your feet are stained with blood. Illerium is infamous for having soldiers gain power by fights to the death.

exits.condition: A dark spire fills the center of the courtyard, blocking your path.
You take a stabilizing breath, preparing yourself for the battle ahead.

ILCOURTYARDSW.name: ILCOURTYARDSW
ILCOURTYARDSW.desc: Many bricks are missing for the courtyard here, either ripped out or just knocked out over time.

exits.condition: Marbled rock walls block your path.
Marbled rock walls block your path.
You take a stabilizing breath, preparing yourself for the battle ahead.

GUARDFIGHT.name: ILCOURTYARDW
GUARDFIGHT.desc: A group of guards block the way forward.

exits.condition: You need to go that way to defeat the ruler of Illerium, but the guards are certainly not going to let you pass while they draw breath.
There appears to be an armory in that direction, but the guards are certainly not going to let you pass while they draw breath.
A dark spire fills the center of the courtyard, blocking your path.
You shout a battle cry to intimidate the guards. They don't even flinch.
You attack the guards, and though you try to parry and defend, an attack slips through.(-3)
exits.onkill: The last of the guards falls to the ground, leaving the path open to press on.

ILCOURTYARDW.name: ILCOURTYARDW
ILCOURTYARDW.desc: Dead guards lay on the bricks, bleeding out onto the already blood-stained stones.

exits.condition: A dark spire fills the center of the courtyard, blocking your path.
You give a prayer of thanks to Omnisci for protecting you through the battle with the guards.

ILARMORY.name: ILARMORY
ILARMORY.desc: Most of the weaponry here is useless to you, but there's one weapon engraved with runes that's glowing in the corner.

exits.condition: Racks of subpar weaponry cover this wall.
Bows are hung from this wall, but you've never cared for ranged weaponry.
Stores of rations are piled against this wall.
YOU: Maybe if they took better care of their weaponry they wouldn't have died...
You pick up the sacred weapon of old. The Dragon's Flame. It flares with energy in your hand, then dies down to low hum of power.

ILCOURTYARDNW.name: ILCOURTYARDNW
ILCOURTYARDNW.desc: Briars snake throgh the bricks of the courtyard here, pushing them up at odd angles.

exits.condition: Marbled rock walls block your path.
Marbled rock walls block your path.
You take a stabilizing breath, preparing yourself for the battle ahead.

ILCOURTYARDSE.name: ILCOURTYARDSE
ILCOURTYARDSE.desc: It looks like they tried to repair part of the courtyard here with some sort of pitch, but it just made a mess of black goo that's barely solid.

exits.condition: Marbled rock walls block your path.
Marbled rock walls block your path.
You take a stabilizing breath, preparing yourself for the battle ahead.

WIZARDFIGHT.name: ILCOURTYARDE
WIZARDFIGHT.desc: A sorceror stands before you, with a ball of energy crackling in his hands.

exits.condition: You do need to get north, but the only way you'll pass this wizard is over his dead body.
A dark spire fills the center of the courtyard, blocking your path.
The wizard has a tower there, but the only way you'll pass him is over his dead body.
You yell a batlle cry, and you see the wizard flinch a little.
You attack the wizard, and he responds by loosing the energy he has gathered. (-5)
exits.onkill: The wizard slumps over, unable to handle the grievous wounds you dealt him.

ILCOURTYARDE.name: ILCOURTYARDE
ILCOURTYARDE.desc: The wizard's blood adds to the color already staining the courtyard bricks.

exits.condition: A dark spire fills the center of the courtyard, blocking your path.
You offer a prayer to Omnisci in thanks for protecting you in your battle against the wizard.

ILTOWER.name: ILTOWER
ILTOWER.desc: A large red potion sits on the table in here, among other vials and equipment.

exits.condition: Tables of alchemy equipment line the walls, quiet and unused.
Shelves of books in anicent langauges stretch across this wall.
This wall has a large drawing of an alchemical circle etched into it.
YOU: I hope that potion is helpful, because I'm gonna need something.
You take the Red Potion.

ILCOURTYARDNE.name: ILCOURTYARDNE
ILCOURTYARDNE.desc: The bricks here are actually white, unstained by blood. Maybe they replace them recently.

exits.condition: Marbled rock walls block your path.
Marbled rock walls block your path.
You take a stabilizing breath, preparing yourself for the battle ahead.

ILCOURTYARDN.name: ILCOURTYARDN
ILCOURTYARDN.desc: North of you lies the entrance to the Illerrium Keep.

exits.condition: A dark spire fills the center of the courtyard, blocking your path.
You take a stabilizing breath, preparing yourself for the battle ahead.

ILHALLS.name: ILHALLS
ILHALLS.desc: Tapestries of brutal wars adorn the walls. The hall heads northward, towards the throne room, where you will face the Ruler of Ellirium.

exits.condition: There are doorways you could enter, but your quarry is north.
There are doorways you could enter, but your quarry is north.
You start a chant to Omnisci as you prepare for you final confrontation.

ILHALLN.name: ILHALLN
ILHALLN.desc: A feeling of dread sets into your bones as you stand outside the throne room.

exits.condition: There are doorways you could enter, but your quarry is north.
There are doorways you could enter, but your quarry is north.
You offer one last prayer to Omnisci before you enter the throne room.

ILTHRONEROOM.name: ILTHRONEROOM
ILTHRONEROOM.desc: Before you stands the ruler of Illerium, Queen Cynthera the Powerful. As you walk in, she turns a sly smile towards you and wordlessly draws her sword.

exits.condition: You aren't leaving this room until Queen Cynthera is dead, or you are.
You aren't leaving this room until Queen Cynthera is dead, or you are.
You aren't leaving this room until Queen Cynthera is dead, or you are.
You aren't leaving this room until Queen Cynthera is dead, or you are.
CYNTHERA: So Desquere sent their fabled champion to face me? FIGHT me, and we'll see if you truly live up to your fame.
You dance in battle with Cynthera. You both manage to land blows, and you know it will be a close battle. (-3)
exits.onkill: Cynthera's blade clatters to the floor, as you strike one last time with Dragon's Flame. The mighty blade pulses with energy and you see the light flicker and die in Cynthera's eyes.

GAMEOVERGOOD.desc:
With Cynthera defeated, you return to Desquere hailed a hero. You return to the mines and bring the baby golden dragon with you to raise to defend the city. From this you begin a new group called the Dragon Riders that herald in a new era of peace and prosperity for the world.


Congratulations! Thanks for Playing!

GAMEOVERBAD.name: GAME OVER
GAMEOVERBAD.desc: As you succumb to your wounds, the world around you goes dark. Illerium invades Desquere within the next few months, pillaging the kingdom. As they learn how to tame the dragons, the usher in a new dark age of fear and pain.
